result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:35 AM Defendant RILEY D. CARLSON in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  David C. Rashid appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information on file; acknowledge receipt.  Reading waived - plea entered. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

CONDITIONS:   Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 03:10 PM Defendant RILEY D. CARLSON in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Defendant RILEY D. CARLSON in custody.  Anthony Prekop appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  RILEY D. CARLSON appeared by video means with Attorney.  DE motion to reduce bond to a signature bond.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law to address bond.  The State objects.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  The Court will not amend bond. 
Defense requests to waive the Prelim now.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Bond Continues.  Record closed @ 3:17.  Arraignment scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:12 AM Defendant RILEY D. CARLSON in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Defendant RILEY D. CARLSON in custody.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  RILEY D. CARLSON appeared by video means with Attorney.  DE filed a motion to dismiss count 4.  Argument by defense & the State.  The Court will deny the motion to dismiss count 4.   DE filed a bond motion Friday, we will set a bond hearing to address that.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 9:20.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
